org.jets3t.service.io
Interface IRepeatableInputStream

All Known Implementing Classes:
RepeatableFileInputStream, RepeatableInputStream
public interface IRepeatableInputStream

An interface that marks input stream that can be repeated, at least under some circumstances - an input stream is repeatable if it can be reset to its starting point and re-read.

Such input streams are useful when transmitting data, as a transmission failure can be recovered from by re-transmitting data from the input stream.

Method Summary
 void repeatInputStream()
          Resets the input stream to the beginning.
 

Method Detail

repeatInputStream

void repeatInputStream()
                       throws java.io.IOException
Resets the input stream to the beginning. After this method call, the input stream will provide data as if it was just created.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - when the input stream cannot be repeated, such as if the amount of buffered repeatable data is insufficient. Ideally this method should throw an UnrecoverableIOException to indicate that no further IO operations as possible.
